Unit Context

Series: He Rongo Kōrero - Podcast Lessons

Connects to: Y8 Systems & Government Unit

Assessment: Podcast Analysis Worksheet

Podcast Series

  • Lesson 1: Te Tiriti o Waitangi (This Lesson)
  • Lesson 2: The Dawn Raids (available through teacher dashboard)
  • Lesson 3: NZ Wars - Stories of Tainui (available through teacher dashboard)

Whakataukī | Proverb

"He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata"

What is the most important thing in the world? It is the people, it is the people, it is the people.

This lesson explores Te Tiriti o Waitangi, a foundational document built on the relationships between peoples.

🎧 Podcast Lesson 1: Te Tiriti o Waitangi

⏱️ 55 minutes 📚 Years 9-11 🇳🇿 NZ Curriculum: Social Sciences Level 5

🎯 Learning Objectives

Knowledge

  • Identify the key participants and motivations behind Te Tiriti o Waitangi.
  • Understand the key differences between the Te Reo Māori and English versions.
  • Recognize the immediate and long-term consequences of the treaty's signing.

Skills

  • Develop active listening and note-taking skills from an audio source.
  • Analyze historical narratives and identify different perspectives.
  • Synthesize information from a podcast to form an evidence-based opinion.

Values

  • Appreciate the significance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi in Aotearoa's history.
  • Value the importance of clear communication and cultural understanding in agreements.
  • Recognize the ongoing relevance of the treaty in contemporary New Zealand.

🎧 The Podcast

The Aotearoa History Show: Te Tiriti o Waitangi

Listen to the episode from RNZ to explore the history and impact of the Treaty of Waitangi.

Listen on RNZ Website | Watch on YouTube

📋 Lesson Structure

🤔 Pre-Listening (10 minutes)

Activating Prior Knowledge

Teacher Action: Distribute the student worksheet. Begin with a class discussion.

Think-Pair-Share: "What is a Treaty?"

  • Think (2 min): Students individually write down what they know about Te Tiriti o Waitangi on their worksheet.
  • Pair (3 min): In pairs, students share their ideas and add to their notes.
  • Share (5 min): Pairs contribute key ideas to a class mind map. Focus on words like 'agreement', 'partnership', 'conflict', 'translation'.

🎧 During-Listening (25 minutes)

Active Listening & Note-Taking

Teacher Action: Play the podcast episode. Students will complete Part 2 of their worksheet as they listen.

Worksheet Task

Students will listen for and record key information on their worksheet, focusing on:

  • Key People: Who were the main figures involved?
  • Key Differences: What were the major differences between the two versions of the treaty?
  • Key Consequences: What happened immediately after the signing?
Teacher Note: You may need to pause the podcast at key moments (e.g., after the explanation of the different versions) to allow students time to write.

🗣️ Post-Listening (20 minutes)

Synthesizing & Discussing

Teacher Action: Facilitate a group and then a class discussion based on the podcast and worksheet notes.

Group Discussion (10 minutes)

In groups of 3-4, students discuss the questions in Part 3 of their worksheet, focusing on the impact and ongoing relevance of the treaty.

Class Debrief (10 minutes)

Each group shares one key insight from their discussion. The teacher can guide the conversation with questions like:

  • "Why is it important to understand both versions of the Treaty?"
  • "How did the podcast change or confirm your understanding of this event?"
  • "Why is Te Tiriti o Waitangi still so important in Aotearoa today?"

📚 Resources & Materials

Required Materials

  • Device with internet access to play the podcast
  • Podcast Analysis Worksheet (1 per student)
  • Whiteboard or chart paper for mind map

Connected Resources

  • Treaty of Waitangi Handout
  • Treaty Two Texts Comparison
